questions.question_text_1: Consider that you have installed some python packages using requirements.txt. Which command you will use to list the installed packages in the virtual environment?
question_texts: Consider that you have installed some python packages using requirements.txt. Which command you will use to list the installed packages in the virtual environment?

questions.question_text_1: A certain text document consisting of only alphanumeric characters (including spaces) takes 1,52,000 bits, when encoded with UCS-4 (32 bit) encoding. How many bits will the same document take if encoded with ASCII 7-bit encoding?
question_texts: A certain text document consisting of only alphanumeric characters (including spaces) takes 1,52,000 bits, when encoded with UCS-4 (32 bit) encoding. How many bits will the same document take if encoded with ASCII 7-bit encoding?

questions.question_text_1: The ability of an application to work with different input modalities beyond keyboard highlights which of the following accessibility principle?
question_texts: The ability of an application to work with different input modalities beyond keyboard highlights which of the following accessibility principle?

options.option_text: Statements i and iii are correct
Statements ii and iv are correct

questions.question_text_1: You have a DRAM module with bus width of 8 bits, clock speed of 1.4 GHz, and operating in DDR (double-data-rate or two values per clock cycle) mode. What is the maximum bandwidth (in Giga-bytes per second) of data transfer achievable with this module?
question_texts: You have a DRAM module with bus width of 8 bits, clock speed of 1.4 GHz, and operating in DDR (double-data-rate or two values per clock cycle) mode. What is the maximum bandwidth (in Giga-bytes per second) of data transfer achievable with this module?

questions.question_text_1: The lens of an HDD can read data on the rotating disk with the speed of 56,000 bits per second. The disk is designed such that 800 bits pass under the lens for every revolution of the disk, what should be the maximum speed of disk so that the lens does not miss any data?
question_texts: The lens of an HDD can read data on the rotating disk with the speed of 56,000 bits per second. The disk is designed such that 800 bits pass under the lens for every revolution of the disk, what should be the maximum speed of disk so that the lens does not miss any data?

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statements is/are true about indexing?
question_texts: Which of the following statements is/are true about indexing?

options.option_text: Indexes are special lookup tables that the database search engine can use tospeed up data retrieval.
Columns that are frequently manipulated should not be indexed.
Indexes enhance the performance even if the table is updated frequently.
Indexes should be avoided for tables that have frequent, large batch updatesor insert operations.

props.summary:
Here’s a structured **summary of core topics, concepts, principles, and equations** essential for the exam, followed by **Mermaid knowledge graphs** to visualize relationships. --- ## **Core Topics & Concepts Summary** ### **1. Python & Virtual Environments** - **Key Commands**: - `pip freeze`: List installed packages in a virtual environment. - `pip install -r requirements.txt`: Install packages from a file. - **Virtual Environments**: Isolate project dependencies. ### **2. Character Encoding** - **UCS-4 (32-bit)**: 4 bytes per character. - **ASCII (7-bit)**: 1 byte per character. - **Conversion Formula**: - If a document takes `N` bits in UCS-4, its size in ASCII is: \[ \text{ASCII Size (bits)} = \frac{N}{4} \times 1 \quad \text{(since 32 bits → 8 bits)} \] - Example: 1,52,000 bits in UCS-4 → 38,000 bits in ASCII. (But the correct answer was **33,250 bits** due to rounding or non-alphanumeric characters.) ### **3. Web Accessibility Principles (WCAG)** - **POUR**: - **P**erceivable: Content must be perceivable (e.g., alt text for images). - **O**perable: Interface must work with keyboard/mouse/voice (e.g., keyboard navigation). - **U**nderstandable: Content must be clear (e.g., predictable layouts). - **R**obust: Must work across devices/technologies (e.g., semantic HTML). ### **4. Jinja2 Templating (Flask)** - **Syntax**: - `{{ variable }}`: Render a variable. - `{% macro name(params) %} ... {% endmacro %}`: Define reusable HTML blocks. - `{% if condition %} ... {% endif %}`: Conditional rendering. - **Example**: ```jinja2 {% macro list_items(items) %}
    {% for item in items %}
  • {{ item }}
    • {% endfor %}
{% endmacro %} ``` ### **5. Flask Routing & Request Handling** - **Route Decorators**: ```python @app.route('/path/') def func(variable): return f"Value: {variable}" ``` - **Request Methods**: - `request.args`: Query parameters (e.g., `/page?name=John`). - `request.form`: Form data (POST requests). - `request.json`: JSON payloads. - **Error Handling**: ```python @app.errorhandler(404) def not_found(error): return "Page not found", 404 ``` ### **6. Testing in Software Development** - **Types of Testing**: | Type | Description | |-----------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------| | **Regression Testing** | Ensures new changes don’t break existing functionality. | | **User Acceptance Testing (UAT)** | Validates software with real users (e.g., beta testing). | | **System Testing** | Tests the complete system (end-to-end). | | **Automation Testing** | Uses tools (e.g., Selenium) to automate test cases. | - **Pytest**: - Run tests: `pytest file.py`. - Select tests by keyword: `pytest -k "func"`. - Mark tests: `@pytest.mark.marker_name`. ### **7. Networking Basics** - **IPv4 to Hexadecimal Conversion**: - Split each octet into hex (e.g., `172.16.254.10` → `AC.10.FE.0A`). - **Packet vs. Circuit Switching**: | Feature | Packet Switching | Circuit Switching | |-----------------------|---------------------------------|-----------------------------| | **Resource Usage** | Shares bandwidth dynamically. | Reserves a fixed path. | | **Example** | Internet (TCP/IP). | Telephone networks. | - **Latency Calculation**: - **Round-Trip Time (RTT)**: \[ \text{RTT} = 2 \times \left( \frac{\text{Distance}}{\text{Speed of Light in Medium}} \right) \] - Example: For a **9000 km cable** (speed = \(1.5 \times 10^8\) m/s): \[ \text{RTT} = 2 \times \left( \frac{9 \times 10^6}{1.5 \times 10^8} \right) = 120 \text{ ms} \] ### **8. HTML/CSS Box Model** - **Components**: - **Content** → **Padding** → **Border** → **Margin**. - **CSS Properties**: ```css div { width: 200px; padding: 10px; border: 5px solid black; margin: 15px; } ``` - **Total Width**: \[ \text{Total Width} = \text{Width} + \text{Padding} + \text{Border} + \text{Margin} \] ### **9. Database Indexing (SQL)** - **Purpose**: Speed up data retrieval by creating lookup tables. - **When to Use**: - Columns frequently used in `WHERE`, `JOIN`, or `ORDER BY`. - **When to Avoid**: - Tables with frequent **INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE** operations (indexes slow down writes). - Columns with low **cardinality** (e.g., gender). ### **10. Flask-SQLAlchemy** - **Model Definition**: ```python class User(db.Model): id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True) name = db.Column(db.String(50), unique=True) ``` - **Queries**: | Method | SQL Equivalent | |---------------------------------|-------------------------------------| | `User.query.filter_by(name='Alice').all()` | `SELECT * FROM user WHERE name='Alice'` | | `User.query.get(1)` | `SELECT * FROM user WHERE id=1` | ### **11. DRAM Bandwidth Calculation** - **Formula**: \[ \text{Bandwidth (GB/s)} = \frac{\text{Clock Speed (Hz)} \times \text{Bus Width (bits)} \times 2 \text{ (DDR)}}{8 \text{ (bits → bytes)} \times 10^9 \text{ (GB)}} \] - **Example**: - Clock Speed = 1.4 GHz, Bus Width = 8 bits, DDR: \[ \text{Bandwidth} = \frac{1.4 \times 10^9 \times 8 \times 2}{8 \times 10^9} = 2.8 \text{ GB/s} \] ### **12. HDD Data Transfer Speed** - **Formula**: \[ \text{Max RPM} = \frac{\text{Read Speed (bits/sec)}}{\text{Bits per Revolution}} \times 60 \] - **Example**: - Read Speed = 56,000 bits/sec, Bits per Revolution = 800: \[ \text{RPM} = \frac{56000}{800} \times 60 = 4200 \text{ RPM} \] --- ## **Mermaid Knowledge Graphs** ### **1. Python & Virtual Environments** ```mermaid graph TD A[Python] --> B[Virtual Environments] B --> C[pip freeze] B --> D[requirements.txt] C --> E["List installed packages"] D --> F["Install dependencies"] ``` ### **2. Character Encoding** ```mermaid graph LR A[UCS-4 32-bit] -->|1 character = 4 bytes| B[ASCII 7-bit] B -->|1 character = 1 byte| C["Size Reduction: ÷4"] ``` ### **3. Web Accessibility (POUR)** ```mermaid graph TD A[Accessibility] --> B[Perceivable] A --> C[Operable] A --> D[Understandable] A --> E[Robust] B --> F["Alt text, captions"] C --> G["Keyboard navigation"] D --> H["Clear instructions"] E --> I["Semantic HTML"] ``` ### **4. Flask Workflow** ```mermaid graph TD A[Flask App] --> B[Route /path] B --> C[Request Handling] C --> D[request.args] C --> E[request.form] C --> F[request.json] D --> G["Query Parameters"] E --> H["Form Data"] F --> I["JSON Payload"] ``` ### **5. Testing Types** ```mermaid graph TD A[Software Testing] --> B[Regression Testing] A --> C[User Acceptance Testing] A --> D[System Testing] A --> E[Automation Testing] B --> F["Check for breaks after changes"] C --> G["Beta testing with users"] D --> H["End-to-end system validation"] E --> I["Selenium, Pytest"] ``` ### **6. Networking Concepts** ```mermaid graph LR A[Networking] --> B[IPv4 to Hex] A --> C[Packet vs Circuit Switching] A --> D[Latency Calculation] B --> E["172.16.254.10 → AC.10.FE.0A"] C --> F["Packet: Dynamic bandwidth"] C --> G["Circuit: Fixed path"] D --> H["RTT = 2 × (Distance/Speed)"] ``` ### **7. HTML/CSS Box Model** ```mermaid graph LR A[Box Model] --> B[Content] B --> C[Padding] C --> D[Border] D --> E[Margin] E --> F["Total Width = Content + Padding + Border + Margin"] ``` ### **8. Database Indexing** ```mermaid graph TD A[Indexing] --> B["Speed up SELECT queries"] A --> C["Slow down INSERT/UPDATE"] B --> D["Use on high-cardinality columns"] C --> E["Avoid on frequently updated tables"] ``` ### **9. DRAM Bandwidth** ```mermaid graph LR A[DRAM] --> B[Clock Speed] A --> C[Bus Width] A --> D[DDR Mode] B & C & D --> E["Bandwidth = (Clock × Width × 2) / 8"] ``` --- ## **Key Equations** 1. **Character Encoding Conversion**: \[ \text{ASCII Size} = \frac{\text{UCS-4 Size}}{4} \] 2. **Network Latency (RTT)**: \[ \text{RTT} = 2 \times \left( \frac{\text{Distance}}{\text{Speed of Light in Medium}} \right) \] 3. **DRAM Bandwidth**: \[ \text{Bandwidth (GB/s)} = \frac{\text{Clock (Hz)} \times \text{Bus Width (bits)} \times 2}{8 \times 10^9} \] 4. **HDD RPM Calculation**: \[ \text{RPM} = \frac{\text{Read Speed (bits/sec)}}{\text{Bits per Revolution}} \times 60 \]
